revised_title: Conferva crispa: A Description of a Freshwater Plant Species
tldr: John Lindley describes the Conferva crispa, a freshwater plant species, and its growth habits. He explains that it is the same species as Linnaeus' Conferva fluviatilis and can form entangled strata in freshwater environments. The green portion represents the young plant, while the white portion is the older, bleached plant.
